qas.question: In which year did Madonna move to New York City?
Which record label did Madonna sign with in 1982?
What was the name of the album she released in 1983?
Name Madonna's Grammy award album in 1998?

context: Born in <a0_0>Bay City, Michigan<a0_0/>, <a3_0>Madonna<a3_0/> moved to New York City in <a1_0>1977<a1_0/> to pursue a career in modern dance. After performing in the music groups Breakfast Club and Emmy, she signed with <a2_0>Sire Records<a2_0/> (an auxiliary label of Warner Bros. Records) in 1982 and released her self-titled debut album the following year. She followed it with a series of commercially and critcally successful albums, including the Grammy Award winners <a4_0>Ray of Light<a4_0/> (1998) and Confessions on a Dance Floor (2005). Throughout her career, Madonna has written and produced most of her songs, with many of them reaching number one on the record charts, including "Like a Virgin", "Into the Groove", "Papa Don't Preach", "Like a Prayer", "Vogue", "Frozen", "Music", "Hung Up", and "4 Minutes".
